author: Business AM
title: Fermeture de la raffinerie de Grangemouth : 400 emplois menacés dans un contexte de difficultés économiques
text:
Principaux renseignements
- La fermeture de la raffinerie entraînera la perte de 400 emplois.
- Les gouvernements britannique et écossais ont annoncé un plan conjoint prévoyant une enveloppe financière de 100 millions de livres sterling pour les travailleurs.
- Petroineos a cité la concurrence croissante des grandes raffineries comme un facteur important dans la décision.
Petroineos, l’exploitant de Grangemouth, la seule raffinerie de pétrole d’
Écosse, a annoncé sa fermeture imminente en 2025, entraînant la perte de 400 emplois. L’entreprise a invoqué les difficultés économiques comme principale raison de sa décision. Grangemouth, créée il y a plus d’un siècle, sera transformée en terminal d’importation de carburants.
Raisons derrière la fermeture
La fermeture de la raffinerie a suscité des critiques de la part des syndicats et des hommes politiques, qui ont exprimé leur consternation face à la perte d’emplois et à son impact sur la base manufacturière et la sécurité énergétique du pays. Les gouvernements britannique et écossais ont annoncé un plan conjoint visant à fournir une enveloppe financière de 100 millions de livres sterling pour soutenir les travailleurs et investir dans des projets énergétiques locaux.
Pressions financières
Petroineos a cité la concurrence croissante de raffineries plus grandes et plus modernes dans d’autres régions comme un facteur important de la fermeture. L’entreprise a fait état de pertes financières importantes ces dernières années, estimant ses pertes quotidiennes à environ 500 000 dollars.
Alternatives potentielles
Avant l’annonce, des campagnes ont été menées pour que la raffinerie reste opérationnelle jusqu’à ce qu’une alternative viable à faible émission de carbone puisse être identifiée. Le gouvernement et Petroineos explorent des options potentielles à long terme telles que l’hydrogène à faible teneur en carbone, les carburants électroniques propres et les carburants durables pour l’aviation.
Implications pour le marché du pétrole
La fermeture de Grangemouth
devrait avoir des répercussions sur le marché du pétrole, car il traite le pétrole brut Forties de la mer du Nord et le WTI Midland des États-Unis, qui contribuent à l’indice de référence mondial du pétrole Brent. Petroineos a précisé que les autres opérations menées à proximité, notamment les installations pétrochimiques et les oléoducs, ne sont pas affectées. author: Shariq Majeed
title: At 6.2°c, Ludhiana Records Season’s Coldest Night | Ludhiana News - Times of India
text: Ludhiana: Ludhiana on Thursday witnessed coldest night of the ongoing December month as the minimum (night) temperature dropped to 6.2°C. Meanwhile, the met department forecasts night temperature to fall further in the next few days. As per the met officials, the minimum (night) temperature in Ludhiana recorded on Thursday was 6.2°C, which is 0.7 degree less than normal and even 1.6 degrees less than a day before.The data of minimum temperature in ongoing December suggests that the minimum temperature had not dropped to this value in the month till now. On December 7 and 8, the minimum temperature was second low in ongoing month and was recorded at 6.4 degrees Celsius.The maximum (day) temperature in city on Thursday was 20.6°C, which is a degree less than normal and 0.9 degree less than the day before.Meanwhile, the met forecasts ‘partly cloudy sky’ on Friday and Sunday whereas for the remaining days till next Wednesday ‘mainly clear sky’ is expected. It also suggests that the day temperature in Ludhiana is expected to rise to 23 degrees till Sunday and fall to 22 degrees by Monday and remain same the next day whereas the night temperature might fall to 4 degrees by Tuesday.We also published the following articles recentlyWinter chill is back; day temperature dips by 4 degrees CelsiusBhopal shivered through its likely coldest day this season, with temperatures dipping to 23.4C, a significant 4.5C below normal. Sunday night saw the mercury plummet to a chilly 9.2C. Experts predict further drops in the coming days, with Bhopal's minimum temperature potentially reaching 8.5C. While Khandwa experienced a high of 30.5C, Shivpuri recorded a low of 6.8C.116149420Kolkata's minimum temperature at 15.7C, season's lowestKolkata experienced its coldest day of the season so far, with the minimum temperature dipping to 15.7C. A western disturbance is expected to bring clouds and slightly raise the temperature to 16C on Monday.116121072Ahmedabad's minimum temperature likely to drop to 11C today, says IMDAhmedabad experienced a chilly Sunday with the minimum temperature dipping to 13.2 degrees Celsius, slightly lower than Saturday and below normal. The maximum temperature also remained cooler than usual at 30.8 degrees.116109858

author: CNN Newsource
title: Suspect in Tabatha Tozzi murder arrested in Mexico after nearly two-year international manhunt
text:
By Alyssa Bethencourt
Click here for updates on this story
 LAS VEGAS, Nevada ( KTNV ) — After nearly two years of heartbreak and unanswered questions, the family of Tabatha Tozzi may finally see justice take a step forward.
Oswaldo Nathanahel Perez-Sanchez, the man accused of killing 26-year-old Tabatha Tozzi in Las Vegas in April 2023, was arrested Tuesday in Sonora, Mexico.
Mexican authorities confirmed in a Facebook post that the Unidad Especializada en Aprehensiones arrested Perez-Sanchez in Ciudad Obregón, acting on a warrant issued by the attorney general’s office in Sinaloa.
Perez-Sanchez is also being investigated in connection with the femicide and forced disappearance of another woman whose body was discovered on April 7, 2025, in Villa Fontana, Culiacán.
He had reportedly been living under the alias “Jorge N” while hiding in the region.
Authorities say he is now being transported to Culiacán, where he will be held at the Aguaruto Penitentiary and presented before the Court of Control and Criminal Prosecution. In a news release on Wednesday, the Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department wrote that Perez-Sanchez’s extradition to the United States is pending.
Las Vegas police thanked multiple agencies for “their extensive follow-up and collaboration with Mexican authorities to locate Pereze-Sanchez,” including the U.S. Marshals Service Nevada Violent Offender Task Force, the U.S. Marshals Service – District of Arizona Tucson, the FBI, DEA Nogales Resident Office and the Customs and Border Protection Special Operations Group in San Diego.
“We have relentlessly pursued this fugitive, and the family can rest knowing that he is now in custody,” District of Nevada U.S. Marshal Gary Schofield stated.
“The collaboration required to apprehend this fugitive exemplifies the importance of teamwork,” added FBI Las Vegas Special Agent in Charge Spencer Evans. “We hope this outcome provides a measure of peace to the family, knowing that he is now in custody.”
A mother’s unimaginable loss
The arrest marks a major development in a case that has gripped the Las Vegas community for nearly two years. Tabatha Tozzi, a young woman described by friends and family as bright, loving, and full of potential, was killed in April of 2023. Metro police say she was shot outside of a northwest Las Vegas home, allegedly by her boyfriend, Perez-Sanchez, before he fled the country.
Her mother, Regina Lacerda, has been a tireless advocate for justice ever since. In multiple emotional interviews, she spoke candidly about the pain of losing her daughter and the torment of knowing the suspect remained at large.
“The day before this happened, she even told me, ‘Mom, I’m not happy. I’m trying to break up with him, but I’m afraid,’” Lacerda previously told Channel 13. “She said she was afraid he’d do something to himself. And I said, ‘To himself or to you?’”
On the morning of the shooting, Lacerda received a frantic call from her daughter asking to be picked up. “I couldn’t make it there on time to save my daughter,” she recalled, through tears.
The search for justice
For months, the Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department and the FBI worked to locate Perez-Sanchez. Ten days after the shooting, Metro Police released his photo to the public. Some, including Lacerda, questioned whether releasing it earlier might have made a difference.
In 2023, on what would have been Tabatha’s 27th birthday, the FBI announced they had officially joined the case, intensifying the international search and raising the reward for information to $30,000.
Retired LVMPD Lieutenant Randy Sutton had said at the time, “You can run for a while, but they are on the scent, and once they’re on the scent, they’re not getting off it.”
A community united: “The Tabby Tribe”
Throughout the investigation, friends and supporters formed what became known as the “Tabby Tribe”—a passionate group determined to keep Tabatha’s memory alive and demand accountability. Vigils, rallies, and memorials were held across the Las Vegas valley.
“My daughter will never be a cold case,” Lacerda told the crowd during a memorial event at the Metro Police Headquarters. “We will always fight for her.”
Please note: This content carries a strict local market embargo. If you share the same market as the contributor of this article, you may not use it on any platform.

author: @riapo
title: Лицеистка рассказала, как проект «Билет в будущее» помогает определиться с профессией | Society | Seldon News
text: - Виктория расскажи, пожалуйста, как ты попала в проект «Билет в будущее»? - В этот проект я попала, когда узнала о нем в школе, на «Разговорах о Важном». Зарегистрировалась на сайте «Билет в будущее» и стала его участником. - Если бы нужно было описать проект одним словом, какое слово тебе приходит в голову? - При описании этого проекта, мне сразу приходит в голову слово «возможности». Ведь «Билет в будущее» — это безграничные возможности для изучения чего-то нового, интересного и полезного. - Как считаешь, что дает школьникам проект «Билет в будущее»? - Я считаю, что проект «Билет в... author: Caitlyn Hitt
title: Leah Remini divorces husband Angelo Pagan after 28 years together and reveals reason for shocking split in candid post
text:
Leah Remini divorces husband Angelo Pagan after 28 years together and reveals reason for shocking split in candid post
LEAH Remini has announced that she and husband Angelo Pagan have decided to divorce after 21 years of marriage.
She shared the news in a lengthy social media post, revealing that life after divorce is unfamiliar territory for both of them.
Leah, 54, announced her divorce on X, formerly Twitter, beginning her long post, "Well, here we are. After 28 years together and 21 years of marriage, we have decided to file for divorce."
She went on to say, "This decision came after a lot of thought and care, and as hard as divorce is, we are approaching this with a positive outlook because we know it’s what’s best for us.
"We are proud of how we have worked through this together."
The King of Queens actress continued, "Yes, we’re sad, and we’ve got some figuring out to do as we continue to move forward into our new normal—together still in many ways, and apart in some new ones.
More Celebrity News
"But here’s the thing: we’ve been best friends for so many years. We are still celebrating holidays together, watching our favorite tv shows together, and gathering as a family.
"So, the big question—why?"
"To put it simply, we both changed, as people do, and we got used to playing roles that didn’t fit us anymore," she added.
"After a lot of effort and consideration, we’ve decided to take this step, which reflects who we are today."
Most read in Celebrity
Leah assured fans, "Our bond is still strong—it’s just evolved into something different.
"We think a marriage that lasted this long and created so many beautiful memories, especially raising our incredible daughter, is something to celebrate. From our perspective, this marriage was a huge success.
"And now, we’re looking forward to creating even more cherished moments—just in a different way."
She noted that they shared their relationship publicly for many years, writing, "We want to be as transparent as we can be here because, for years, we shared our marriage so publicly, whether it was on our specials on VH1 or our reality show, which ran for two seasons on TLC.
"We are sharing this unknown territory with you all as we take our first steps into this next stage of our lives publicly.
"We would love for everyone to have more access to different kinds of relationship stories and not feel so isolated in navigating the changes that millions of couples make every year."
Her message concluded with, "We hope our journey can inspire others to see that relationships—whether they change or end—aren’t failures.
"We’ll keep sharing snippets of our lives as we navigate this new chapter."
More to follow... For the latest news on this story, keep checking back at The U.S. Sun, your go-to destination for the best celebrity news, sports news, real-life stories, jaw-dropping pictures, and must-see videos.

author: 郑鑫
title: 江西都昌："百村千树"项目助力乡村绿化 - 民生 - 中工网
text:
央视网消息 在第47个植树节来临之际，在江西省九江市都昌县土塘镇刘云村开展“百村千树”乡村绿化美化项目，为乡村增添盎然绿意，助力乡村生态文明建设。
在刘云村，村民和志愿者们将金丝楠木、银杏树、红叶石楠等苗木栽种到道路两旁、房前屋后。自江西省“百村千树”行动开展以来，当地依据自身情况科学规划，都昌县土塘镇刘云村此次种树1000棵，村庄绿化覆盖率显著提升，乡村生态环境大为改善。
“利用这段天气的有利时机栽种苗木，能大大地增加苗木的存活率。‘百村千树’项目既增加了乡村绿化总量，提升乡村绿化品质，又改善农村人居环境，以更优美生态环境赋能乡村振兴。”九江市林业局驻土塘镇刘云村工作队队员尹超亚告诉记者。
据了解，“百村千树”项目自2023年启动，计划用三年时间，每年在江西省选取100个左右自然村，开展乡村绿化美化项目建设，每个项目点新栽或补植不少于1000株树木。
（总台记者 唐嘉伟 刘昀彤）

author: Observador
title: As auroras boreais voltaram na noite desta quinta-feira de Orçamento a Portugal. Cinco meses depois, o céu está de novo colorido de rosa – Observador
text:
Cinco meses depois, as luzes do Norte desceram novamente até latitudes muitos baixas e onde são muito raras de avistar. Resultado: esta noite, se estiver num local com pouca luz e com o céu sem muitas nuvens, agarre na câmara e verá auroras boreais em Portugal. Já correm várias imagens nas redes sociais, com as luzes, sobretudo em tons rosa e roxo, a colorirem zonas no Centro e Norte do País. Acontece o mesmo no Sul de Espanha, até nas ilhas baleares, e um pouco por toda a Europa.
No alto da Serra da Estrela! Não sei se é Aurora Boreal! Mas vou pensar que sim! #aurora #Auroraborealis pic.twitter.com/MF5RZfxgZG
— Maria (@terebelar) October 10, 2024
Aurora boreal desde a Serra da Padrela, Alto Tâmega e Barroso, Portugal #Auroraborealis pic.twitter.com/3xipyPaBc3
— Márcio Santos – Meteorologia e Ambiente (@MeteoTrasMontPT) October 10, 2024
A culpa é de uma enorme tempestade solar. Uma erupção na crosta do Sol, que ocorreu às primeiras horas da madrugada de dia 9, de classe X, uma das mais intensas, e que seguiu em direção à Terra. Na noite desta quarta-feira, quando atingiu a atmosfera terrestre, a tempestade geomagnética era de intensidade G4, num máximo é G5, com um índice de magnitude Kp de 8, no máximo de 9.
PUB • CONTINUE A LER A SEGUIR
Ahora!
Bella #aurora boreal desde la Catedral de Ely en Cambridgeshire, Inglaterra #TormentaSolarGeomagnetica #Auroraborealis
Vía @VeronicaJoPo pic.twitter.com/2yNn4L8mbW
— Geól. Sergio Almazán (@chematierra) October 10, 2024
É esta intensidade e magnitude que permite que as auroras boreais sejam visíveis em latitudes mais a Sul, cerca de 40 a 44º, e não fiquem limitadas às luzes do Norte, nome pelas quais são conhecidas, já que as partículas emitidas nas tempestades solares são atraídas pela zona magnética dos polos, nomeadamente do Polo Norte. A hora prevista da chegada da tempestade era às 17h00 (mas com uma grande margem de incerteza). Mas, mal se pôs o sol, não houve atrasos: chegaram as primeiras imagens.
Muito intensas nas zonas habituais (Islândia, Noruega, Suécia), mas ténues nos países onde são tão raras, como Portugal ou Espanha — as auroras apareceram visíveis bem a Sul, até nas ilhas baleares.
Aurora Boreal visible des de Punta Nati, Menorca.
????Jesus Liz pic.twitter.com/160Rjb57Um
— MeteoDadesBalears (@balearicsmeteo) October 10, 2024
Aurora boreal desde #Nagore #ValledeArce #Navarra @AEMET_Navarra @ElTiempo_tve @ElTiempoNavarra @DiariodeNavarra @NoticiasNavarra @RTVENavarra @ElTiempoA3 @eguraldiaETB pic.twitter.com/qbBudXeMow
— Javier Idiazabal Chourraut (@JChourraut) October 10, 2024
Vuelve a verse la aurora boreal desde el norte de la península ibérica, a ver si en las próximas horas tenemos sorpresa por el sur https://t.co/ODmIwG8PBD
— meteocr (@meteocr) October 10, 2024
Desde Villanueva de Córdoba, muy leve pero algo se intuyen. #Auroraboreal pic.twitter.com/fQ7k2MA0Uc
— AstrofotografA_Ana (@anam2fernandez) October 10, 2024
⚠️ Impresionante como va ganando intensidad la Aurora Boreal.‼️
Así se ve ahora desde el observatorio astronómico de calar Alto en Almería. pic.twitter.com/TrtyPdGinz
— AMETSE (@MeteoSE) October 10, 2024
#auroraboreal está noche desde Granada pic.twitter.com/8HLMHDMyXg
— Elvira Guerrero (@Eangela82) October 10, 2024
Horizonte norte en el Observatorio de Torremocha del Jiloca (Teruel) hace unos minutos. Segunda noche de 2024 que nos regala auroras boreales visibles desde 40 grados de latitud???? pic.twitter.com/TLgKyml9Kg
— Vicente Aupí (@VicenteAupi) October 10, 2024
A 10 de maio Portugal tinha assistido a uma rara aurora boreal. A primeira desde 25 de janeiro de 1938. Agora, bastaram cinco meses para voltar a ver novamente uma.
Auroras boreais coloriram os céus de Portugal
